introduction.heading: We are a community benefit society
introduction.content: D첫thchas Arainn is a community benefit society that exists to hold assets for the Isle of Arran community, land, buildings, infrastructure with the aim of natural conservation and protection of our community heritage.

duthchas.content: "D첫thchas" is a Gaelic word that means a great many things, connection to land and people, the affinity to a place. Although Gaelic is much less prevalent on Arran in the 21st century, we believe that it is an important part of our island heritage, and that D첫thchas encompasses our connection to our island home.

register.heading: Register your interest in membership
register.content: If you would like to get involved, leave your email with us and we will add you to our mailing list. We will notify you of any planned meetings and announcements.

goals.heading: We aim to (amongst other aims!)
content: Secure by community asset transfer, and conserve, expand and connect areas of remaining ancient woodland for conservation, community access and regenerative land management, outdoor activities and education
Maintain and improve waterways within these woodland both for research, community enjoyment and conservation, but also flood mitigation purposes for our village communities
To investigate further, and preserve and protect, our cultural monuments throughout this highly rich and under researched landscape
